item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • City: Cheektowaga
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the BUFR location. The fiberboard box contained a plastic bottle packaged in a plastic bag with a absorbent pad. The cap was loose on the bottle and it spilled all of the contents. It was placed into a steel salvage package and will be disposed of as hazardous material.

item.title: Report I-2024080046
item.description:
Report I-2024080046

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After service had been completed, Keith Miller(U265254) began to pick up trash. While going down the aisle, passenger gave Keith a cup for the trash with the vape inside of the cup, and a little bit of water it looked like He did not realize at the time what was in the cup After Purser informed the captain she came up behind Keith and informed him they need to grab the TCB because she found out someone's vape was beginning to go rouge Realizing it was in the trash they went to go retrieve it, crew stated it was Ieaking a little of the vapors and described it as pineapple scented They followed SOP and placed the TCB in the aft most lavatory(this instance they placed it in aft right Iav)

item.title: Report E-2024080428
item.description:
Report E-2024080428

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: AMSTERDAM
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 1, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was damaged in transit by unsecured freight and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. Crews overpacked one (1) 55-gallon drum of Brake and Parts Cleaner into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. Crews transported the drum to Antioch R+L terminal for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024080261
item.description:
Report E-2024080261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: LIVERPOOL
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FREEHOLD CARTAGE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 25, 2024, three (3) 55-gallon drums of UN2922 waste spilled in transit due to improper containment. As a result, the drums released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the trailer interior, which further migrated to the parking lot below. Freehold Cartage retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental (ME) to remediate the impacted site. ME personnel utilized a vacuum pump to transfer product to a new 55-gallon poly drum. Crews worked to contain the release underneath and around the exterior of the trailer. ME personnel secured the site and scheduled to return at a later date for additional remedial operations. On July 26, 2024, a crew from ME returned to the site for additional remediation. ME personnel utilized a pallet jack to transfer the undamaged freight to the trailer for normal transport. All UN2922 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.
